docs.lead_paragraph: Regulators in Florida yesterday rejected a proposal to let a troubled subsidiary of the Health Insurance Plan of Greater New York gradually make up a $4.8 million shortfall in its financial reserves. The Florida Department of Insurance instead gave the subsidiary, HIP Health Plan of Florida, until Aug. 15 to restore the reserve to the legally required level, by either lining up an investor willing to pump cash into the operation or securing a joint venture with another health care company.

headline.main: Florida Rebuffs HIP's Proposal To Raise Funds

docs.abstract: Florida insurance regulators refuse to allow HIP Health Plan of Florida, subsidiary of New York plan, to gradually make up $4.8-million shortfall in its financial reserves (S)
